itemDescription: British military man, diplomat and antiquary, 1777-1860

wikipedia_page.main: William Martin Leake (14 January 1777 – 6 January 1860) was an English military man, topographer, diplomat, antiquarian, writer, and Fellow of the Royal Society. He served in the British military, spending much of his career in the Mediterranean and the Balkans. He developed an interest in geography and culture of the regions visited, and authored a number of works, mainly about Greece.
